tls:text.tls:line: As soon as I saw this I exclaimed in delight:

sense.def: realise, be able to understand what is not immediately visible; see through, recognise the true nature of

tls:text.tls:line: As soon as I saw this I exclaimed in delight:

sense.def: with delight, in a delighted tone of voice

tls:text.tls:line: When some day my Comprehensive Catalogue will be finished

sense.def: in the near future; soon afterwards; another time in the future

tls:text.tls:line: After some time I passe by Píngjiāng

sense.def: pass by; make a passing visit to; visit on an informal basis, visit en passant; go to; pass through, pass by

tls:text.tls:line: He was hoping to ask me for an introduction.
He was hoping to ask me for an introduction.

sense.def: meritorious political or military achievement, meritorious exploits; contributions; proper ultimate function; effective performance (e.g. in cutting off heads!); intended result; results, success

tls:text.tls:line: 1. Because of secrecy,
as in the case of the (relevant) dhārani.
2. Because of ambiguity
2. Because of ambiguity
3. Because the thing in question does not exist (in the target country).
In China there is in fact no such tree.

tls:text.tls:line: In China there is in fact no such tree.
It is not that this cannot be translated,
but since the time of Mātanga (died 73) there has always been used the Sanskrit sound.
but since the time of Mātanga (died 73) there has always been used the Sanskrit sound.
as when prajnā has great weight whereas (the Chinese) zhìhuì "mundane wisdom" has little weight and is superficial.

sense.def: intellectual competence; mundane versus higher Buddhist wisdom

tls:text.tls:line: that the name Shakyamuni refers to "being capable of humaneness".
then the Buddha's rank would be lower than that of the Duke of Zhōu and of Confucius.
then the Buddha's rank would be lower than that of the Duke of Zhōu and of Confucius.

sense.def: be humble/low in status as compared to

tls:text.tls:line: In this land the teaching of Lǎozǐ was there first.
The supreme true Way (of the Taoists) would then be no different (from the Way of the Buddha).
The supreme true Way (of the Taoists) would then be no different (from the Way of the Buddha).

sense.def: correct and genuine [note the tonal caccophony of this binome! One would expect 真正.]

tls:text.tls:line: would be called a living being with a mind bent on the great way.

sense.def: a sentient being; any sentient being; just an ordinary sentient being

tls:text.tls:line: would be called a living being with a mind bent on the great way.

tls:text.tls:line: In our state they die order imperial counselors to become Delegated Sutra Translators and Text Polishers.
The genuine and the were intermixed
The sharpness of his spirit was as if it came from the whetstone.
and studied as well as familiarised himself with the practice of the Tiāntái great teaching.

sense.def: study and familiarise oneself with the practice of

tls:text.tls:line: and he duly received the obscure discourse of this man.

sense.def: paying diligent attention to all details

tls:text.tls:line: and he held forth for the assembly.
and he held forth for the assembly.

sense.def: hold forth on the Buddhist Way

tls:text.tls:line: and the shower of generous love poured forth from him.
he thought about paying back the generosity of his parents,
He lived in a hut by the tomb of his ancestors
As she approached death she was perfectly contented.

sense.def: be perfectly happily contented (often in spite of adversities)

tls:text.tls:line: The fiery beam left Buddha-relics behind

sense.def: BUDDH: relics of the Buddha or occasionally of another famous Buddhist monk; relic pellets (referring to the crystalline remains left over after cremation) SANSKRIT Śarīra

tls:text.tls:line: two dried stems of lotos flowers.
rose up to the Buddhist Heaven.
rose up to the Buddhist Heaven.

sense.def: BUDDH: Buddhist heaven; skr. trāyastriṃśa, pali tāvatṃsa (In Buddhist cosmology this heaven is the second heaven among the six heavens of the realm of desire ( 欲界 ); at this place the god 係帝釋 is residing. It is situated at the top of Mt. Sumeru and in the four directions there are eight heavenly cities each.; the city where the above god resides is called 善見城 or 喜見城. All in all there are 33 places in this heaven, called 三十三天. These places are mentioned and described in 正法念處經, fasc. 25. The description of this heaven is quite popular in Indian sūtra literature since the mother of Buddha was said to have been reborn there after her death, and Buddha ascended to this heaven in order to preach the dharma for his mother for 3 months. ( 雜阿含經, fasc. 19, 23, 45; 中阿含經, fasc. 1; 長阿含經, fasc. 3; 增一阿含經, fasc. 28, 33, 37; 正法念處經 fasc. 26-35; 大智度論 fasc. 9, 56.)

tls:text.tls:line: rose up to the Buddhist Heaven.
summoned his disciples and said:
You
you should seek to save yourself and quick as you can.

sense.def: V before it is too late!

tls:text.tls:line: you should seek to save yourself and quick as you can.

sense.def: cause one's own salvation> save oneself

tls:text.tls:line: My last request is
He dwelt in this world for 71 years

sense.def: dwell in this world> remain alive

tls:text.tls:line: so as to display it and burn incense near it.
these [translation] terms be suppressed?
